text: “I know that @PatDonahoeArmy is committed to it, I am committed to it. The White House has expressed commitment to it and I think we will be able to take it further,” Sen. @ossoff said.

Sen. @ossoff is committed to improving housing on post at Ft. Benning:

“I have already been engaged in discussions with the White House officials to get high level buy in from the Biden administration to invest in improving housing facilities on post.”

https://www.wtvm.com/2021/04/02/sen-jon-ossoff-tours-ft-benning-evaluate-quality-housing/

The Chattahoochee River Valley will see significant funding as well, with over $2.8 million headed to Valley Healthcare System in Columbus and over $15.6 million going to CareConnect Health, Inc. in Richland. http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1378792157511872519/pu/img/kLhWs9NLB-DNrXMz.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1378792157511872519/pu/vid/480x270/J63vi9gSunFMZghg.mp4?tag=12

Over $21 million is headed to multiple health centers across Southwest Georgia, including $8.8 million for Albany Area Primary Health Care in Albany and $2.5 million to South Central Primary Care Center, Inc. in Ocilla.

https://www.walb.com/2021/04/01/million-covid-relief-funds-coming-swga-health-centers/ http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1378793488863653895/pu/img/5tKsJfL4VcDnw2xF.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1378793488863653895/pu/vid/480x270/3Lv-bMhHqKW6vreh.mp4?tag=12

Three health centers in the Augusta area will receive a combined $12 million:

-Neighborhood Improvement Project, Inc: $3,625,500

-Christ Community Health Services Augusta, Inc: $2,261,750

-East Georgia Healthcare Center, Inc: $5,799,750

https://www.wrdw.com/2021/04/01/local-health-centers-to-receive-millions-from-american-rescue-plan/

In addition, Coastal Community Health Services in Brunswick will receive over $2.1 million, which CEO Barbara Meyers said will "allow us to have expanded capacity to respond to COVID-19 pandemic," and get staff back to their primary jobs.

https://thebrunswicknews.com/news/local_news/coastal-community-health-gets-2-1-in-federal-covid-19-relief/article_e9d6ad16-61ff-5543-9f31-f422ac723134.html

More than $12 million is headed to three community health centers in the Savannah area:

-Diversity Health Care, Inc. in Hinesville: $2,195,500

-J C Lewis Health Center in Savannah: $4,559,625

-Curtis V Cooper Primary Health Care, Inc. in Savannah: $5,989,375 http://pbs.twimg.com/ext_tw_video_thumb/1378791053076086785/pu/img/xcH3S9Omh2XbDeBh.jpg https://video.twimg.com/ext_tw_video/1378791053076086785/pu/vid/480x270/ThkGYI4iBGG85NbE.mp4?tag=12

ICYMI: This week, Sen. @ossoff & @SenatorWarnock announced $143 million going to community health centers across GA, which deliver comprehensive, high-quality care often to low-income families, people experiencing homelessness, & veterans.

All thanks to the American Rescue Plan.
